page.title: 17War Memorial,Abergele Road
page.content: The Memorial is a landmark and a meeting-place.It is a lovely grey stone column,about 2 metres high,with a Celtic cross on top.A sword is engraved on the front.The Memorial cost Â£365.5s.0d on land at the bottom of Pencoed Rd. given by Mr.R.J.Wynne. The first inscription honours the names of 9 men who died in the First World War,and 8 more names came after 1939-45.There is a poem dedicated to the dead,called "The sons of Britain",by Mrs.J.Jones. "Ye noble sons of Britain That wait by land and sea, To strike a blow for freedom, For right and liberty;.......... Your tasks are hard and many, And perils lurk unseen, A truer race of patriots This world has never seen.
